I've noticed that when you create a new room, as an exit from another room, it places it in the tree as a stand alone room (rather than containing it in the room it exits from).

Because of the order in which I've built my world, this sometimes means that an exit from a room may be way way down the tree and things can become confusing. To try and keep things in order, I've just spent 10 minutes dragging various rooms into the rooms from which they exit. A quick test and I didn't detect any errors, but have I made a terrible mistake doing this, by changing the default way the game places the rooms in the tree?

If you look at this screengrab from my tree, you can see how all my apartment rooms are now within the starting room (bedroom). Before this, each room/exit was alone in the tree, making the tree very long. Is this okay?

Well, now your lounge is technically inside the bedroom, so it might show up as an object there.

A better approach might be to create a "bedroom zone" room, then have the bedroom, lounge, bathroom and kitchen all inside that.
